data.title: Text in drop-down menu next to tabs is blank
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Debian 9 - Godot v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
When I click the arrow next to a tab in the editor, I get a drop-down menu with a few boxes in it, but no text - it's very unclear what these options will do.

![screenshot_2017-06-19_18-33-45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1923178/27308747-539b869c-551e-11e7-8beb-9606a514ee06.png)

This is the full console log from an editor instance in which this problem appeared:

```
jon@terralibre:~$ godot
WARNING: initialize: Could not find cursor theme
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:346.
OPENING: /home/jon/sources/godot-demo-projects/2d/platformer (::home::jon::sources::godot-demo-projects::2d::platformer)
WARNING: initialize: Could not find cursor theme
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:346.
jon@terralibre:~$ WARNING: _png_warn_function: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
   At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:66.
WARNING: _png_warn_function: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
   At: drivers/png/image_loader_png.cpp:66.
```


**Steps to reproduce:**

Download and run Godot v2.1.3.stable.official on a Debian 9 system. (Unfortunately this is the only such system I have available at the moment, so I don't know if this is universal.)

data.title: Add null-check to get_normal_frame
data.body:
#9266 demonstrates a bug with AnimatedSprite that crashes Godot. I reproduced as described in the issue and captured this backtrace of the crash:

> 0x000000000150afde in Vector<Ref<Texture> >::_get_size (this=0x40) at core/vector.h:60
> 0x000000000150a59a in Vector<Ref<Texture> >::size (this=0x40) at core/vector.h:112
> 0x0000000001a93f3d in SpriteFrames::get_normal_frame (this=0x81611b0, p_anim=..., p_idx=0) at scene/2d/animated_sprite.h:102
> ...

Examining the third stack frame showed that `EN` was in fact a null pointer. After adding the null check I can no longer reproduce #9266.

data.title: Small Deploy with Network in iOS untethered
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS Sierra & iOS 10 - Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Using Small Deploy with Network requires launching from Xcode with "Arguments passed on Launch". This is a slow process because it requires Xcode open, the iOS Device connected, Xcode installs the app every time it runs, checks signatures, a lot of work and you cannot use it without the device connected to a Mac

Instead, it would be better to add the "-rfs <IP>" argument in the Info.plist file rather than or besides the Arguments passed on launch option, this way you can just tap the app icon in the device and launch into this mode instantly, speeding up testing and being able to use it untethered

Labels:
Enhancement, Usability

data.title: Window scaling in Win10
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Scaling option in Windows is set to 125%. Game window is upscaled messing up the resolution - if the game is setup to run at native resolution of the screen then part of the window is outside of the screen.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set Windows upscaling to something greater than 100% and run a game in fullscreen or borderless window with the size of the screen.

data.title: Align primitive defaults to default collision shape sizes
data.body:
This is in reaction to #9242, this only changes the default sizes of the primitive meshes to match the in world sizes of the collision shapes.

I do agree with the observation in 9242 that the cube collision shape is double the size it should be. I have no opinion one way or the other if the capsule should be reorientated in the mesh or as a collision shape. However since we're still debating which way this will go I haven't changed anything here. 

I suggest not merging this PR until we have a final say as there is a good argument to change the cube and prism back to size (1.0, 1.0, 1.0). I think the radius of 1.0 for our spheres and capsules are good defaults.

data.title: Fix regression in script debugger (2.1)
Itertools like class in gdscript - to aid procedural generation
data.body:
Basically I stumbled on an issue that requires me to return an array that holds all possible combinations of a sequence.
I filed it as a question here:
https://godotengine.org/qa/15813/function-that-returns-all-possible-combinations-sequence

> Class1 = [1,2,3,4] Class2 = [1,2,3,4] Class3 = [1,2,3,4]
> 
> Now what I would like to do is return all possible combinations of
> these three classes.
> 
> Example:
> 
> 1 1 1
> 2 1 1
> 3 1 1
> 4 1 1
> 1 2 1
> 2 2 1
> 3 2 1
> 4 2 1
> ...

That functionality is available in python - as a module called itertools.
Trying to write a function that does what I want in gdscript is proving to be dificult without the product itertools module.

Doing that in python would be as simple as:
```
import itertools
iterables = [ [1,2,3,4], [88,99], ['a','b'] ]

for t in itertools.product(*iterables):
     print t
```

That module would be incredibly useful when you want to automatically generate enemies with different types of armor for example - as it can create an array with all possible combinations of boots + helmets + chest for example 

In my case, I am very close to writing a tool for godot that can aid artists and my tool needs that functionality. But I can see this being useful for games too

data.title: Fix error spam when generating script preview
MultiNodeEdit bug
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Manjaro Linux 64bit Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When an Instanced Scene is present and the children are set so that they are not able to be edited, I find the multi edit enables itself when you select one of these children in the viewport and then select another object not related to the Instanced node.
Here is a picture:
![screenshot_2017-06-18_22-22-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16758490/27268338-9e4161da-5474-11e7-8867-69357b7879c8.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Make an instanced scene
2) Make a new scene
3) Add the instanced scene to the new scene
4) add more nodes to the new scene
5) make the instanced scene's children uneditable in the scene panel
6) select a child of the instanced scene in the viewport
7) select a node from step 4 in the scene panel
8) click on other nodes and notice that the multi-edit is still active

data.title: Camera2d enhancements
data.body:
![camera2d_enhancements](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25082678/27264838-10399466-5456-11e7-8e06-ba9fbc954af4.png)
I added various enhancements for Camera2D:

- Added an option to draw Camera2D's limits
- Added an option to draw Camera2D's drag margin
- Made drawing the Camera's screen bounds optional
- Put all of these option under a new group, "Editor helpers", in Camera2D
- Made Camera2D's editor lines less transparent if is set to current
- Added function calls to _update_scroll() in various places so the editor lines are updated when the values change
- Added variables and set/get functions for toggling the editor lines.

I can remove or change anything if needed. I'm not sure on changing the transparency on the editor lines, but I liked being able to see if a camera was current or not at a glance.

There is one issue I couldn't figure out how to fix. If you scale the Camera2D node by a negative value, the limit bounds editor lines start moving.

Closes #8175

data.title: Fix ColorPicker's screen pick functionality
KinematicBody2D move() pushes too far outside of collider
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux x86_64, Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When running move() in a way that would move a kinematicbody2d into a tilemap (which I assume uses a staticbody2d), the move will move you out of the collider too far, causing you to float a short distance (less than 0.05 units for shorter moves) outside of the collider, rather than moving directly onto its surface. This causes jitteryness when handling gravity and wall collisions, and can even cause things like accidental jump boosts when hugging walls, if working on a small scale (in this case, 512x512 window size running at 0.125x scale)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Place a square with a staticbody2d and any collider with a flat surface (square works nicely).
Create a kinematicbody2d with a collider (square works nicely).
Put into `_fixed_update()` code to run `move()` that causes it to run into the collider head-on.
Watch it micro-jitter like hell.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[game.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1083324/game.zip)
Controls: w/d + space, or left+right+up
In this, a high jump can be achieved by uncommenting the `move()` in the collision check for `res://scripts/player.gd`, and then hugging the walls as you jump

data.title: Vehicle physics behave strangely (regression)
data.body:
I know that the physic engine is changing; so it should expected that some features will behave differently, so this may not be actually a bug.


from the https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/tree/2.1/3d/truck_town demo I've stripped the basic car, then exported the GD2 project to GD3 (I had just to rename the godot.project file); and made a video on how differently the car behave in the two engine.

https://matrix.org/_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/eMBwSLTXeDijwgVENfuLZjfH


file project are here: https://matrix.org/_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/CsfnnmOhTPOBZXHanolAeHPV

data.title: Changing (highmemory) scene cause GDscript to force to run next line and crash?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10. 
Godot 2.1.3
Pure Node2D

**Issue description:**
Code of the old scene keeps going even after I call this function: 

`get_tree().change_scene("res://Game/Credits.tscn")`

**Steps to reproduce:**

So I've SceneA and SceneB

SceneA use 1.5 GB ram when it's running (contains heavy assets made in DragonBones). So when I change from SceneA to SceneB with "get_tree().change_scene()", GDscript just continue the code of SceneA till it crashes, doesn't even have time to load SceneB.

When I test the same code again in HTML5 version it works... the scene does change, but according to the debugger the code in SceneA kept going till it crashed (just almost immediately). But at least it loads the SceneB and game is still functional.

This function I cast from SceneA:
```
func goodcredits():
	print("==============starting the credits===============")
	var nodesingroup = get_tree().get_nodes_in_group("WelcomeMap")
	nodesingroup.empty()
	nodesingroup.clear()
	get_tree().change_scene("res://Game/Credits.tscn")
	print("================================================")
```
Is this a bug? Or do I have to destroy/clear SceneA somehow before I change to SceneB?

data.title: Added two new methods 'blend_rect_mask' and 'fill'
data.body:
Added two new methods in 2.1 as well, '**blend_rect_mask**' and '**fill**'.
Corresponding PR for 3.0 is : #9251 

**blend_rect_mask** blends two rectangles together using the alpha channel of a mask to specify which pixels to use.
**fill** will fill an Image resource with a specified color

Test example is provided in attachment [blendtest21.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1083243/blendtest21.zip)

data.title: Added three new methods to 3.0: 'blend_rect', 'blend_rect_mask' and 'fill'
data.body:
Converted **blend_rect** to 3.0 too and also added two new methods '**blend_rect_mask**' and '**fill**'
[blendtest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1083213/blendtest.zip)

**blend_rect_mask** blends two rectangles together using the alpha channel of a mask to specify which pixels to use.
**fill** will fill an Image resource with a specified color

Test example is provided in attachment.

Will add the corresponding PR for 2.1 as well in a few minutes.

data.title: Custom InputMap actions don't work in exported project
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0 master (33bf180), Windows 10

**Issue description:**
Any actions I create in the editor have no InputEvents associated with them in the exported project. The result being that none of the actions are ever triggered. You can verify the problem with InputMap.get_action_list(...)
The built-in actions (ui_* stuff) work fine.

Have I missed something crucial about setting up actions?

Note that when launching from the editor - or a binary in the project folder - the actions work fine.
This is not tied to debug/release/tools builds, but seemingly the exported data (.cfb?) in the .pck file (at write or read time?).

example project: 
[action_test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1083140/action_test.zip)

Try running from editor and exporting and running.
Press space ("action1") and the up key ("ui_up") and see the counters change.
action1 works from editor/project but not when exported
The top line shows the results of get_action_list (empty when exported).

data.title: ColorPicker: fix DPI, hue & color update issues
data.body:
Fix the following issues:
- Popup is too small on VeryLoDPI
- Scaling on HiDPI (need testing)
- Color not update when dragging sliders
- When dragging UV pick to white or black, hue changes to red (still happens when editing via sliders)

Closes #9184, #9224
